member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.DateBehavior.GetValidMonth
member.summary: Retrieves the month on the textbox as a valid value.
member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the month (1 - 12).
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the month on the textbox. If it is within the allowed range, it returns it. If it is less than the minimum allowed, the minimum is returned. If it is more than the maximum allowed, the maximum is returned.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.DateBehavior.GetValidDay
member.summary: Retrieves the day on the textbox as a valid value.
member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the day (1 - 31).
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the day on the textbox. If it is within the allowed range, it returns it. If it is less than the minimum allowed, the minimum is returned. If it is more than the maximum allowed, the maximum is returned.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.DateBehavior.GetValidYear
member.summary: Retrieves the year on the textbox as a valid value.
member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the year.
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the year on the textbox. If it is within the allowed range, it returns it. If it is less than the minimum allowed, the minimum is returned. If it is more than the maximum allowed, the maximum is returned.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.DateBehavior.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the month, day, and year on the textbox using a object.
member.remarks: This property gets and sets the boxed inside an object. This makes it flexible, so that if the textbox does not hold a valid date, a null is returned, instead of having to worry about an exception being thrown.

member.summary: Gets or sets the mask.

This string is used for validating and/or formatting the characters entered by the user. By default, the # symbol is configured to represent a digit placeholder on the mask. Thus, each '#' symbol in the mask represents a digit, and any other characters between the # symbols are automatically filled-in as the user types digits.
If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.GetValidHour(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the hour on the textbox as a valid value.
member.param: If true, the value is validated based on a 24-hour format, regardless of the property; otherwise it is based on the property.
member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the hour.
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the hour on the textbox. If it is a valid hour, it returns it. If it is less than it should be, the minimum is returned. If it is more than it should be, the maximum is returned.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.GetValidMinute
member.summary: Retrieves the minute on the textbox as a valid value.
member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the minute.
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the minute on the textbox. If it is a valid minute, it returns it. If it is less than it should be, the minimum is returned. If it is more than it should be, the maximum is returned.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.GetValidSecond
member.summary: Retrieves the second on the textbox as a valid value.
member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the second.
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the second on the textbox. If it is a valid second, it returns it. If it is less than it should be, the minimum is returned. If it is more than it should be, the maximum is returned.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.GetValidAMPM
member.summary: Retrieves the AM/PM symbol on the textbox as a valid value.
member.returns: The return value is the valid value for the AM/PM symbol.
member.remarks: The method checks the value of the AM/PM symbol on the textbox. If it is a valid AM/PM symbol, it returns it; otherwise it returns the AM symbol.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.Hour
member.summary: Gets or sets the hour on the textbox.
member.exception: Setting this property with an invalid hour.
member.remarks: If the hour is not valid on the textbox, this property will return -1. This property must be set with a valid hour -- between 0 and 23.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.Minute
member.summary: Gets or sets the minute on the textbox.
member.exception: Setting this property with an invalid minute.
member.remarks: If the minute is not valid on the textbox, this property will return -1. This property must be set with a valid minute -- between 0 and 59.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.Second
member.summary: Gets or sets the second on the textbox.
member.exception: Setting this property with an invalid second.
member.remarks: If the second is not valid on the textbox, this property will return -1. This property must be set with a valid second -- between 0 and 59.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.AMPM
member.summary: Gets AM/PM symbol on the textbox.
member.remarks: If the AM/PM symbol is not valid or is not being shown on the textbox, this property will return an empty string.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.ConvertTo24Hour(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Converts an hour in 12-hour format and its AM/PM symbol to its 24-hour equivalent.
member.param: The hour value to convert, in 12-hour format (1 to 12).
The AM/PM symbol which denotes if the hour is between 0 and 11, or 12 and 23.
member.returns: The return value is the hour converted to 24-hour format (0 to 23).

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.ConvertToAMPMHour(System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Converts an hour in 24-hour format to its 12-hour equivalent.
member.param: The hour value to convert, in 24-hour format (0 to 23).
The returned AM/PM symbol, used to denote if the hour was between 0 and 11, or 12 and 23.
member.returns: The return value is the hour converted to 12-hour format (1 to 12).

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the hour, minute, and second on the textbox using a object.
member.remarks: This property gets and sets the boxed inside an object. This makes it flexible, so that if the textbox does not hold a valid time, a null is returned, instead of having to worry about an exception being thrown.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.SetTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the hour, minute, and second on the textbox.
member.param: The hour to set, between 0 and 23.
The minute to set, between 0 and 59.
The second to set, between 0 and 59.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method to set each value individually using a single method. A object is constructed using these parameters, so they must be valid.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.SetTime(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the hour and minute on the textbox.
member.param: The hour to set, between 0 and 23.
The minute to set, between 0 and 59.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method to set each value individually using a single method. A object is constructed using these parameters, so they must be valid. If the second is being shown on the textbox, it is set to 0.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.IsValid
member.summary: Checks if the textbox's time is valid and falls within the allowed range.
member.returns: If the value is valid and falls within the allowed range, the return value is true; otherwise it is false.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.IsValid(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the textbox's time is valid and optionally if it falls within the allowed range.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets the error message used to notify the user to enter a valid time value within the allowed range.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.RangeMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value allowed.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to DateTime(1900, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0), however the range is only checked when the control loses focus if one of the flags is set.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.RangeMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value allowed.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to DateTime(1900, 1, 1, 23, 59, 59), however the range is only checked when the control loses focus if one of the flags is set.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.IsWithinRange(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Checks if a time value falls within the allowed range.
member.param: The time value to check.
member.returns: If the value is within the allowed range, the return value is true; otherwise it is false.
member.remarks: Only the time portion is checked; the date is ignored.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.Separator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to separate the hour, minute, and second values of the time.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set according to the user's system. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.Show24HourFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the hour should be shown in 24-hour format.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set according to the user's system. If the format is set to 12-hour format the AM/PM symbols are also shown; otherwise they are are not shown. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: P:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.ShowSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the seconds should be shown (after the minutes).
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to false, so that the seconds are not shown. If this property is changed, is automatically called.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.SetAMPMSymbols(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the symbols to use for AM and PM.
member.param: The symbol to use for AM.
The symbol to use for PM.
member.exception: The lengths of the parameters are not the same.
member.remarks: By default, the symbols are set according to the user's system. This method allows them to be changed, however, they must both be identical in length. If the symbols are changed, is automatically called.

member.name: M:Fireasy.Windows.Forms.TimeBehavior.GetAMPMSymbols(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the symbols used for AM and PM.
member.param: The symbol used for AM.
